error.noData: No data currently available for this chart

prompt.spectrograms: Click on the baseline and polarisation label to see a detailed spectrogram
prompt.subArrayMany: Choose the SubArray that you wish to see charting for
prompt.subArrayOne: There is only one active Subarray at present

label.expectedH: Expected and Fitted H Beam Widths
label.expectedV: Expected and Fitted V Beam Widths
label.tolerance: Tolerance on H and V fitted Beam Widths

button.refresh: Click if a refresh is required quicker than the scheduled interval

settings.amplitude: Determines the scale to be used for the Y-Axis
settings.phase: Determines the scale to be used for the Y-Axis

spectrumPlot.title: Spectrum Plot
spectrumPlot.content: For each polarisation, we present the mean autospectrum averaged over all channels and baselines. This is the broad continuum spectrum of the source.

amplitudePlot.title: Power vs Phase
amplitudePlot.content: For each baseline and polarisation, a plot of the amplitude of the visibility spectrum is displayed. This provides information about whether a source has been resolved.

phasePlot.title: Power vs Phase
phasePlot.content: For each baseline and polarisation, a plot of the phase of the visibility spectrum is displayed. This provides information about the source's offset from the phase centre.

spectrogram.title: Spectrograms
spectrogram.content: For each baseline and polarisation, we present a waterfall plot of the phases of the visibilities as a function of frequency. A flat spectrum of phases is synonomous with zero residual delay.

lagPlot.title: Lag Plots
lagPlot.content: For each baseline and polarisation, we present a waterfall plot of the inverse Fast Fourier Transform of the visibility spectrum. This is the cross correlation power as a function of lag and any residual delay manifests itself in a shift of the peak from zero.

cross.title: Cross Elevation Offset
cross.content: The fitted parameter representing the centre of the primary beam provides the elevation and Cross-elevation offsets, along with their uncertainties.

elevation.title: Elevation Offset
elevation.content: The fitted parameter representing the centre of the primary beam provides the elevation and Cross-elevation offsets, along with their uncertainties.

expectedH.title: Expected and Fitted H Beam Widths
expectedH.content: The expected and fitted widths of the 2D gaussian primary beam are displayed, along with their uncertainties.

expectedV.title: Expected and Fitted V Beam Widths
expectedV.content: The expected and fitted widths of the 2D gaussian primary beam are displayed, along with their uncertainties.

tolerance.title: Tolerance on H and V fitted Beam Widths

height.title: Fitted Height
height.content: The expected and fitted heights of the 2D gaussian primary beam are displayed, along with their uncertainties.
